questions.question: What is the main advantage of OFDM over single-carrier systems?

answers.c: Converts frequency-selective fading into flat fading per subcarrier
answers.d: Eliminates the need for channel coding

explanations.a: Incorrect. OFDM generally requires the same bandwidth as single-carrier systems.
explanations.b: Incorrect. OFDM transmitter complexity is generally higher due to FFT processing.
explanations.c: Correct. OFDM splits the wideband channel into many narrowband flat-fading subcarriers, simplifying equalization.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Channel coding is still needed in OFDM systems.

questions.question: Which of the following systems uses OFDM?

explanations.a: Incorrect. AM radio uses amplitude modulation, not OFDM.
explanations.b: Incorrect. GSM uses TDMA and FDMA, not OFDM.
explanations.c: Correct. Modern Wi-Fi standards use OFDM for high data rates and robustness.
explanations.d: Incorrect. CDMA uses spread spectrum, not OFDM.

questions.question: What ensures orthogonality among subcarriers in OFDM?

answers.a: Using different modulation schemes per subcarrier
answers.c: Subcarriers are spaced at multiples of the inverse of the OFDM symbol duration

explanations.a: Incorrect. Modulation schemes do not ensure orthogonality.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Orthogonality is not maintained by time separation but frequency spacing.
explanations.c: Correct. Proper subcarrier spacing ensures orthogonality and prevents inter-carrier interference.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Power allocation does not affect orthogonality.

questions.question: The frequency spacing between subcarriers in OFDM is:

explanations.a: Incorrect. Subcarrier spacing must be chosen carefully.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The total bandwidth contains all subcarriers but spacing is smaller.
explanations.c: Correct. This spacing ensures subcarrier orthogonality.
explanations.d: Incorrect. SNR does not determine subcarrier spacing.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to mitigate Inter-Symbol Interference (ISI) in OFDM?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Raised cosine filtering is common in single-carrier systems.
explanations.b: Correct. Cyclic prefix absorbs delayed echoes to prevent ISI.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Low-pass filters do not specifically mitigate ISI in OFDM.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Guard bands reduce interference but do not directly mitigate ISI.

questions.question: OFDM is particularly effective in which type of channel?

explanations.a: Incorrect. OFDM works well beyond AWGN channels.
explanations.b: Correct. OFDM converts frequency-selective fading into flat fading per subcarrier, simplifying equalization.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Flat fading can be handled by simpler single-carrier systems.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Interference-limited conditions require other mitigation techniques.

questions.question: What is the role of the Inverse Fast Fourier Transform (IFFT) in an OFDM transmitter?

answers.a: Modulate data onto the carrier frequency
answers.b: Convert frequency-domain symbols into time-domain waveform

explanations.a: Incorrect. IFFT does not directly modulate on carrier frequency.
explanations.b: Correct. IFFT converts the set of modulated subcarriers into a time-domain OFDM symbol.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Demodulation is done at the receiver using FFT.

questions.question: In OFDM, the cyclic prefix should be:

answers.b: Longer than the entire OFDM frame
answers.c: Longer than the channel delay spread
answers.d: Equal to the number of subcarriers

explanations.a: Incorrect. CP is a small fraction of the symbol duration.
explanations.b: Incorrect. CP length is much shorter than the OFDM frame.
explanations.c: Correct. CP must be longer than maximum channel delay spread to avoid ISI.
explanations.d: Incorrect. CP length is measured in time, not subcarrier count.

questions.question: What type of equalizer is commonly used in OFDM systems?

explanations.a: Incorrect. OFDM typically uses simple frequency-domain equalization.
explanations.b: Correct. Each subcarrier is equalized independently by scalar multiplication in frequency domain.
explanations.c: Incorrect. LMS is more common in single-carrier adaptive systems.
explanations.d: Incorrect. DFE is not commonly used in OFDM.
